definitions: person who owns or manages a small retail store or shop
examples: The friendly shopkeeper recommended several local products
Our neighborhood shopkeeper has run the store for thirty years

definitions: act of stealing merchandise from a store while pretending to be a customer
examples: Security cameras were installed to prevent shoplifting incidents
The teenager was caught shoplifting candy from the convenience store

definitions: person who visits stores to look at or purchase merchandise
examples: Holiday shoppers crowded the mall searching for gifts
The grocery shopper carefully compared prices before buying

definitions: edge where land meets a body of water such as ocean or lake
examples: Waves crashed against the rocky shoreline during the storm
We walked along the shoreline collecting interesting shells

definitions: fault or failure to meet a certain standard or expectation in performance
examples: The report highlighted several shortcomings in the proposal
Despite his shortcomings, he remained a valuable team member

definitions: route that is shorter than the usual way between places
method that saves time or effort in accomplishing something
examples: We took a shortcut through the park to reach school
The narrow alley provided a convenient shortcut to downtown
Learning keyboard shortcuts increased her productivity significantly
There are no shortcuts to mastering a musical instrument

definitions: solid fat used in baking to make pastries tender and flaky
act or process of making something shorter in length or duration
examples: The recipe calls for butter instead of vegetable shortening
Add shortening to the flour mixture until crumbly
The shortening of daylight hours signals autumn's arrival
Budget constraints led to shortening of the conference

definitions: amount by which something falls short of what is required or expected
examples: The company faced a significant revenue shortfall this quarter
A shortfall in donations threatened the charity's programs

definitions: method of rapid writing using symbols and abbreviations for words
shortened or abbreviated way of expressing or referring to something
examples: The secretary took meeting notes using Gregg shorthand
Court reporters must master shorthand to record testimony
The term became shorthand for any technological failure
Using acronyms is common shorthand in text messaging

definitions: list of selected candidates or items that have been chosen from a larger group
examples: Three applicants made the shortlist for the position
The novel appeared on the prize committee's shortlist

definitions: baseball player positioned between second and third base in the infield
examples: The shortstop made a spectacular diving catch
She played shortstop throughout her college baseball career

definitions: gun with a long smooth barrel designed to fire shells containing small pellets
examples: Hunters often use a shotgun for bird hunting
The farmer kept a shotgun to protect against predators

definitions: act of speaking or calling out very loudly often in anger or excitement
examples: The shouting from the stadium could be heard blocks away
Their argument escalated into angry shouting

definitions: tool with broad blade and handle used for digging or moving loose material
examples: He used a shovel to clear snow from the driveway
The gardener reached for her shovel to plant trees

definitions: riverboat with theater for performances as it travels along waterways
person who tries to attract attention through showy behavior or actions
examples: The historic showboat offered dinner and entertainment cruises
Mark Twain wrote about showboats on the Mississippi River
The player was criticized for being a showboat on field
His showboat antics annoyed his more modest teammates

definitions: glass case or cabinet used for displaying valuable or interesting items
event or situation designed to exhibit someone's abilities or something's best features
examples: The museum's showcase contained rare ancient artifacts
She arranged her trophies carefully in the showcase
The concert served as a showcase for local talent
The tech conference was a showcase for innovative startups

definitions: final test or confrontation intended to settle a dispute or rivalry
examples: The championship game was a showdown between rivals
The debate became a political showdown over healthcare policy

definitions: female dancer who performs in elaborate costumes as part of a theatrical show
examples: The showgirl wore an elaborate feathered headdress on stage
She worked as a showgirl in Las Vegas for years

definitions: act of displaying something for others to see or examine
quality of performance or evidence of ability in a particular situation
examples: The gallery announced a showing of contemporary sculptures
We attended a private showing of the new collection
The team made a strong showing in the tournament
Her poor showing in the interview cost her the job

definitions: person who produces or presents shows as a profession with theatrical flair
examples: The circus showman introduced each act with enthusiasm
P.T. Barnum was perhaps America's most famous showman

definitions: skill in dramatic or entertaining presentation with style and flair to impress audiences
examples: The magician's showmanship captivated the entire audience
Her natural showmanship made every presentation memorable

definitions: outstanding example of something displayed or presented to impress others
examples: The restored vintage car was the showpiece of his collection
The new hospital became a showpiece for modern healthcare design

definitions: large room where goods are displayed for customers to examine before purchasing
examples: The car dealership's showroom featured the latest models
Customers browsed furniture in the spacious showroom

definitions: act or performance so impressive it brings prolonged applause
problem or issue that prevents progress or completion of something
examples: Her solo was the showstopper of the musical
The acrobatic finale was a real showstopper
The budget deficit became a showstopper for the project
A critical bug was a showstopper for the software release

definitions: scheduled time when a performance or movie begins at a theater
examples: We need to hurry because showtime is at eight
The theater posts showtime schedules on their website

definitions: small metal pieces that scatter from an exploding bomb or shell
examples: Doctors removed shrapnel from the soldier's wounds
The explosion sent shrapnel flying in all directions

definitions: narrow strip or piece torn or cut from something
very small amount or piece of something abstract like evidence
examples: She tore the letter into shreds and threw it away
The machine turns documents into tiny shreds
There wasn't a shred of evidence against him
He doesn't have a shred of compassion

definitions: machine that cuts paper into thin strips or small pieces for security
examples: The office shredder jammed with too many papers
She fed the confidential documents through the shredder

definitions: small insect-eating mammal with a long pointed snout and tiny eyes
woman regarded as having an unpleasant and quarrelsome temperament
examples: The tiny shrew scurried through the garden undergrowth
Shrews must eat constantly due to their high metabolism
Shakespeare's play features Katharina as the shrew
The old stories unfairly portrayed her as a shrew

definitions: high-pitched scream or cry expressing fear, excitement, or pain
examples: A shriek of terror came from the haunted house
The children's shrieks of delight filled the playground

definitions: small marine crustacean with long tail and many legs often eaten as food
person who is smaller than average especially in height
examples: The restaurant serves fresh shrimp with cocktail sauce
We caught shrimp using nets in shallow water
Don't call him shrimp just because he's short
The shrimp on the team proved size doesn't matter

definitions: holy place dedicated to a specific deity, saint, or religious purpose
examples: Pilgrims visited the ancient shrine to pray for healing
She created a small shrine in her garden

definitions: process of becoming smaller in size especially through washing or drying
loss of inventory in retail through theft, damage, or accounting errors
examples: The sweater showed significant shrinkage after washing
Allow for shrinkage when cutting fabric for sewing
The store manager tracked shrinkage rates monthly
Employee theft contributed to inventory shrinkage

definitions: process of decreasing in size, amount, or importance
examples: The shrinking ice caps concern climate scientists
Budget cuts led to shrinking class sizes

definitions: cloth used to wrap a dead body for burial
something that covers or conceals like a veil
examples: The ancient shroud was carefully preserved in the museum
They wrapped the body in a white shroud
Morning mist created a shroud over the valley
A shroud of secrecy surrounded the negotiations

definitions: woody plant smaller than a tree with several stems from the base
examples: She planted flowering shrubs along the garden border
The birds nested in the dense shrub

definitions: area planted with shrubs or a collection of shrubs
examples: The landscaper designed attractive shrubbery around the building
Children played hide and seek in the shrubbery

definitions: sudden trembling movement of the body from fear, cold, or disgust
examples: A shudder ran through her at the scary scene
The old house gave a shudder in the strong wind

definitions: slow dragging walk without lifting feet properly from ground
act of mixing playing cards to random order before dealing
examples: His tired shuffle showed his exhaustion
The elderly man's shuffle was slow but steady
Give the deck a good shuffle before dealing
The dealer's shuffle was swift and professional

definitions: act of walking without lifting feet or moving things around in different order
examples: The shuffling of papers filled the quiet office
His constant shuffling annoyed the other library patrons

definitions: practice of deliberately avoiding or rejecting someone as punishment or disapproval
examples: The community's shunning of the family was harsh punishment
Social shunning can cause serious psychological harm

definitions: railway track arrangement for moving trains between lines
medical tube inserted to drain fluid or divert blood flow
examples: The freight cars waited on the shunt track
Workers operated the shunt to redirect the train
The doctor inserted a shunt to relieve brain pressure
The shunt helped drain excess fluid effectively

definitions: closing of a factory, business, or system temporarily or permanently
examples: The government shutdown affected thousands of workers
A technical problem caused a complete system shutdown

definitions: game in which one team prevents the opponent from scoring any points
examples: The pitcher threw a shutout against the rival team
Their defense achieved three consecutive shutouts

definitions: hinged cover for a window that can be closed for security or light control
device in a camera that opens briefly to allow light to reach film
examples: She closed the wooden shutters against the storm
The house featured decorative shutters on every window
The camera's shutter clicked rapidly during the photo shoot
Adjust the shutter speed for better action shots

definitions: act of closing something such as a door, window, or business
examples: The shutting of the factory devastated the local economy
We heard the shutting of doors throughout the building

definitions: breed of cat with pale fur and darker face, ears, feet, and tail
relating to twins joined together at birth sharing body parts
examples: Her Siamese cat had bright blue eyes
Siamese cats are known for being vocal
The doctors successfully separated the Siamese twins
The term Siamese twins comes from historical cases
